# DC Exercises Chapter 17

Problem 17.1.1: 
• Boys' names ending in a vowel

<!-- -->

    # load the data
    data("BabyNames")

    # top 10 boys' names ending in a vowel
    BabyNames %>%
      filter(sex == "M") %>%
      group_by(name) %>%
      summarise(total = sum(count)) %>%
      filter(grepl("[aeiou]$", name)) %>%
      arrange(desc(total)) %>%
      head(10)

    ## # A tibble: 10 x 2
    ##    name       total
    ##    <chr>      <int>
    ##  1 George   1451408
    ##  2 Joshua   1163815
    ##  3 Jose      539924
    ##  4 Kyle      469045
    ##  5 Lawrence  454323
    ##  6 Joe       448953
    ##  7 Willie    447403
    ##  8 Jesse     407183
    ##  9 Bruce     379233
    ## 10 Eugene    377338

Problem 17.1.3: 
• top 10 names ending with "joe" (like BettyJoe)

    # top 10 names ending with "joe" 

    # one interpretation: including the name "Joe" 
    BabyNames %>%
      filter(grepl("[Jj]oe$", name, ignore.case = TRUE)) %>%
      group_by(name) %>%
      summarise(total = sum(count)) %>%
      arrange(desc(total)) %>%
      head(10)

    ## # A tibble: 7 x 2
    ##   name       total
    ##   <chr>      <int>
    ## 1 Joe       460274
    ## 2 Billyjoe     393
    ## 3 Bobbyjoe      89
    ## 4 Marjoe        12
    ## 5 Billiejoe      6
    ## 6 Maryjoe        6
    ## 7 Johnnyjoe      5

    # another interpretation: not including the name "Joe" 
    BabyNames %>%
      filter(grepl(".joe$", name, ignore.case = TRUE)) %>%
      group_by(name) %>%
      summarise(total = sum(count)) %>%
      arrange(desc(total)) %>%
      head(10)

    ## # A tibble: 6 x 2
    ##   name      total
    ##   <chr>     <int>
    ## 1 Billyjoe    393
    ## 2 Bobbyjoe     89
    ## 3 Marjoe       12
    ## 4 Billiejoe     6
    ## 5 Maryjoe       6
    ## 6 Johnnyjoe     5
